note:
<Help Description>

<Custom Regenerate Effect>

if ($gameVariables.value(292) > 0) {
  // The HP regeneration rate.
var rate = 0.025;
// Create the value for HP regenerated.
var value = Math.ceil(rate * user.mhp);
  // User gains HP amount.
user.gainHp(value);
}
</Custom Regenerate Effect>

name: ShockShield
note:
<Help Description>
Ice infused with electricity protects you, reflecting damage from melee attacks.
</Help Description>

<HP Protection: Damage Cut 20%>

<Custom React Effect>
// Check to see if any physical damage is dealt.
if (value > 0 && this.isPhysical()) {
// Sets the Recoil Rate to 20%.
var rate = (0.01 * $gameVariables.value(305));
// Determines the amount of recoil damage dealt.
var recoil = value * rate;
// Rounds up the recoil damage.
var dmg = Math.ceil(recoil + ($gameActors.actor(1).atk * 0.1));
// Makes the attacker lose damage equal to the dmg variable, plus 10% of players power.
user.gainHp(-1 * dmg);
// Check to see if the attacker is dead.
if (user.isDead()) {
// If the attacker is dead, make it collapse.
user.performCollapse();
}
}
</Custom React Effect>

name: Protection
note:
<Help Description>
Each golem is protecting Alexander, taking 15% of incoming damage from direct attacks on his behalf.
</Help Description>

Note that damage reduction applies before 
any other effects here, and so as a result
the damage redirection value has a bunch of
extra stuff to account for that and ensure
the damage that is redirected is not reduced.
If you are doing this without reducing the
value first, it would just be 
var dmg = Math.floor(value * 0.15);

<Custom React Effect>
if (value > 0) {
var dmg = Math.floor(value * (0.15 / (1 - (.15 * $gameVariables.value(1055)))));
$gameTroop.members()[1].gainHp (-dmg);
$gameTroop.members()[1].startDamagePopup();
$gameTroop.members()[1].clearResult();
$gameTroop.members()[3].gainHp (-dmg);
$gameTroop.members()[3].startDamagePopup();
$gameTroop.members()[3].clearResult();
$gameTroop.members()[6].gainHp (-dmg);
$gameTroop.members()[6].startDamagePopup();
$gameTroop.members()[6].clearResult();
}
</Custom React Effect>

<state damage modifier: defender>
  return Math.round(d * (1 - (0.15 * $gameVariables.value(1055) ) ) )
</state damage modifier>
